conclusion: Understand the initial setup of a straight metal rod in a uniform magnetic field.
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force is given by ε = B · L · v.
The rod is bent into two equal-length segments, each of length L/√2.
The bent rod moves at speed v in the direction of the angle bisector of the two segments.
Each segment moves at an angle of 45° to the direction of the magnetic field.
Calculate the effective length for each segment in the direction of motion as L/2.
The induced EMF for each segment is ε'_segment = B · (L/2) · v.
The total induced EMF ε' is the sum of the EMFs induced in each segment.
